info.name: API Automation Test Framework for GP Connect Prescriptions Management FHIR API
info.description: ## End-to-end Overview Use this API to manage a patient's prescriptions as held by their GP practice. You can: - request a new instance of a repeat prescription - view all of a patients medications, whether acute or repeat, past or present - cancel a repeat prescription request - check the status of a current prescription request - request a new instance of a repeat prescription to a one off nomination pharmacy The end user must be a patient who is: - registered with the GP practice - registered with NHS login to P9 identity verification level For example: - a patient can view their own medication, request a new instance of a repeat prescription and cancel that request ## Overview of the API automation framework The purpose of this automation suite is to check that the data returned from the Prescriptions Management FHIR API conforms to the specifications outlined in the documentation. The documentation can be found here: 1. General overview as well details of each request: [https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/gp-connect-patient-facing-prescriptions-fhir#overview--overview](https://) 2. FHIR specifications for each endpoint: [https://simplifier.net/guide/GP-Connect-Patient-Facing-Prescription-Management/Home/FHIR-Assets/All-Assets?version=current](https://) The tests are primarily designed to test the shape of the returned data, rather than the exact values returned, except where those values should remain constant. Examples of the logic tested are that: - all required properties are returned - elements within an array do not exceed the number specified - conditionally required elements are only present where the stated conditions are met - fixed values are always returned The automation framework covers only one positive test for each endpoint (excluding the task endpoint which has 3 tests), but all scenarios for error tests (tests returning 4XX statuscodes). The remaining positive tests, using differing optional parameters in the request, are covered in manual tests. ## Why Postman Postman was chosen as the API testing application in order to simplify running, maintaining and developing the framework for both technically and non-technically minded people as the user interface makes it more accessible. ## Installation - Install Postman, go to: [https://www.postman.com/downloads/](https://) - Download this test collection to your local PC - Open the collection using postman ## Structure The framework is split into folders and subfolders reflecting the endpoints of the API (ignoring the baseUrl). Let's take the following endpoint as an example: You would find the tests for this endpoint at: Patient > Id > MedicationStatement. The actual tests can be found by clicking on any test file and looking under the 'Tests' header: All tests are written in javascript. Each test is titled using BDD syntax using the 'Given', 'When', 'Then' format, as well as a small description above the test. All test files will contain mostly similar tests. They include checking the headers returned are correct, the status code returned is as expected, as well as the schema (the structure of the data) is correct. Towards then end, each file will contain some tests specific to that endpoint, relating to the logic encorporated within the specs. ## User-flow The requests in this folder are designed to run through requests as they might be by a user and MUST be run in sequence for them to work. ## Setup Before running any tests you must change the following: - Change the baseUrl variable. The baseUrl is currently pointing towards the NHS sandbox environment. To run this against your own testing environment, the base url will need to be changed. To do this: - select the collection - from the top panel, select the 'Variables' option - change the 'baseUrl' 'Initial value' to the one for your environment - Change all existing variables that need changing to those present in your database. Do this by following the same steps as above and replacing the other Initial values with existing ones in your database. Those that need changing are marked as "PleaseReplaceWith... etc". These variables MUST be updated to match those existing in your database BEFORE the tests can be run. Do NOT update any variables that do not begin with "PleaseReplaceWith", they are set within the tests themselves. - Authorization token may need to be added to the header for the requests as well as a statement within the API framework to ignore authentication when receiving said token. This framework is not designed to test authentication, rather the shape of the returned data, and therefore does not implement authentication as it will be in production. ## Running one test - Select a test you'd like to run from the left hand pannel, eg: MedicationRequest > Id > Positive tests > Get a specific planned medication request - Press send - Results will be displayed below: ## Running the collection - Right click the collection from the left hand panel - Select 'Run collection' - Either leave all tests selected or select specific ones you'd like to run - Select to run manually as a one off or schedule to run them frequently - Select the orange 'run' button: - The tests will now run. The passed tests, failed tests, skipped tests, time taken to run etc... will be displayed at the top: ## Adding tests To add tests, simply use the three dots next to an existing folder and either select to add a new folder or add a new request. You can copy existing tests over or write your own, and make sure to keep the existing format and/or update this documentation to reflect your changes ## Capturing evidence To capture test evidence of the collection run, the following needs to be done: - Right click the collection from the left hand panel - Select 'Run collection' - **Check 'Persist responses for a session'** - Select the orange 'run' button: - Once the run has finished you should see 'Export results' in top right: - Select this to download the results - As well as this, you will need to capture the requests sent for each request - Select each request in turn. Eg click on this request: - The following will appear with a response and request header: - Copy the content of both the response AND request into a text document, clearly labelled with the name of the request - Do this for each request sent - You will now have a file with the request and response for each request in text format as well as the downloaded file in json format as evidence ## Further help If you'd like further help on using postman, visit the Postman learning centre: [https://learning.postman.com/docs/introduction/overview/](https://)

item.name: Get a specific planned medication request

exec: pm.test("GIVEN I provide an existing valid Medication Request ID, WHEN I send the request, THEN the status code response is 200", () => {
pm.test("GIVEN I provide an X-Correlation-ID in the header, WHEN I send the request, THEN the same X-Correlation-ID is returned in the response header", () => {
pm.test("GIVEN I provide an X-Request-ID in the header, WHEN I send the request, THEN the same X-Request-ID is returned in the response header", () => {
pm.test("GIVEN I send a request, WHEN the response is returned, THEN the content-type in the header is set to 'application/fhir+json; charset=utf-8'", () => {
pm.test("GIVEN I send a MedicationRequest request, WHEN the response is returned, THEN the json response corresponds to the required MedicationRequest schema", () => {
//if intent = plan, identifier.system must be https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4122

pm.test("GIVEN I send a request with an existing and valid medication request ID, WHEN the response is returned, THEN the medication request ID in the response matches the id in the request url", () => {

pm.test("GIVEN I send a request with an existing and valid medication request ID, WHEN the response is returned, THEN the medication request ID in the response matches the id in the request url", () => {
//returned medication request id matches the one that was requested

pm.test("GIVEN I send a request with an existing and valid medication request ID, WHEN the response is returned, THEN the medication request ID in the response matches the id in the request url", () => {
//if therapy type of medication request is continuous or continuous repeat then extension must be present

pm.test("GIVEN I want to get an existing medication request AND therapy type is either continuous or continuous-repeat-dispensing, WHEN I send the request, THEN the response contains MedicationRequest.extension", () => {
//if extension exists and intent = plan, authorisation expiry date should exist

pm.test("GIVEN I want to get an existing medication request AND therapy type is either continuous or continuous-repeat-dispensing AND intent of the medication request = plan, WHEN I send the request, THEN the url value of one of the objects in the extension array is authorisationExpiryDate ", () => {
//if extension exists and intent = order, authorisation expiry date should NOT exist

pm.test("GIVEN I want to get an existing medication request AND therapy type is either continuous or continuous-repeat-dispensing AND intent of the medication request = order, WHEN I send the request, THEN no url value of one of the objects in the extension array is authorisationExpiryDate ", () => {
//if extension exists, number of repeat prescriptions should exist

pm.test("GIVEN I want to get an existing medication request AND therapy type is either continuous or continuous-repeat-dispensing, WHEN I send the request, THEN the url value of one of the objects in the extension array = numberOfPrescriptionsIssued ", () => {
pm.test("GIVEN I send a request with an existing and valid medication request ID, WHEN the response is returned, THEN the property BasedOn.reference exists AND starts with MedicationRequest", () => {
pm.test("GIVEN I send a request with an existing and valid medication request ID, WHEN the response is returned, THEN the property BasedOn.reference does not exit", () => {

header.description:
An optional ID which you can use to track transactions across multiple systems. It can have any value, but we recommend avoiding `.` characters.
Mirrored back in a response header.

(Required) A globally unique identifier (GUID) for the request, which we use to de-duplicate repeated requests and to trace the request if you contact our helpdesk.
Must be a universally unique identifier (UUID) (ideally version 4).

Mirrored back in a response header.

If you re-send a failed request, use the same value in this header.

Required in all environments except sandbox.

request.description:
## Overview

This end point returns MedicationStatements relating to a patient, which show courses of medication prescribed to the patient.

These MedicationStatements must reference a MedicationRequest within the basedOn attribute: MedicationRequests provide details of specific prescriptions. The display within basedOn should quote the courseOfTherapyType from the referenced MedicationRequest, showing the prescription treatment type.

The referenced MedicationRequest must have intent set to plan.

The request must include the following parameter:

* patient

item.name: Get prescription issue details - Patient id

exec: pm.test("GIVEN I provide an existing valid patient ID, WHEN I send the request, THEN the status code response is 200", () => {
pm.test("GIVEN I provide an X-Correlation-ID in the header, WHEN I send the request, THEN the same X-Correlation-ID is returned in the response header", () => {
pm.test("GIVEN I provide an X-Request-ID in the header, WHEN I send the request, THEN the same X-Request-ID is returned in the response header", () => {
pm.test("GIVEN I send a request, WHEN the response is returned, THEN the content-type in the header is set to 'application/fhir+json; charset=utf-8'", () => {
pm.test("GIVEN I send a request for a patient's history of medication requests, WHEN the response is returned, THEN the json response corresponds to the required schema", () => {
//returned medication requests are all for the patient specified in request url
pm.test("GIVEN I send a request with an existing and valid patient ID, WHEN the response is returned, THEN the patient id in the response matches the id in the request", () => {
//if therapy type of medication request is continuous or continuous repeat and intent = plan, then extension must be present

pm.test("GIVEN I want to get an existing medication request AND therapy type is either continuous or continuous-repeat-dispensing, WHEN I send the request, THEN the response contains MedicationRequest.extension", () => {
pm.test("GIVEN I want to get an existing medication request AND intent equals order, WHEN I send the request, THEN the response contains MedicationRequest.dispenseRequest.performer", () => {
//if intent = plan, dispenseRequest.performer should not exist
pm.test("GIVEN I want to get an existing medication request AND intent equals plan, WHEN I send the request, THEN the response does not contain MedicationRequest.dispenseRequest.performer", () => {
//if extension exists and intent = plan, authorisation expiry date should exist

pm.test("GIVEN I want to get an existing medication request AND therapy type is either continuous or continuous-repeat-dispensing AND intent of the medication request = plan, WHEN I send the request, THEN the url value of one of the objects in the extension array is authorisationExpiryDate ", () => {
//if extension exists and intent = order, authorisation expiry date should NOT exist

pm.test("GIVEN I want to get an existing medication request AND therapy type is either continuous or continuous-repeat-dispensing AND intent of the medication request = order, WHEN I send the request, THEN no url value of one of the objects in the extension array is authorisationExpiryDate ", () => {
//if extension exists, number of repeat prescriptions should exist

pm.test("GIVEN I want to get an existing medication request AND therapy type is either continuous or continuous-repeat-dispensing, WHEN I send the request, THEN the url value of one of the objects in the extension array = numberOfPrescriptionsIssued ", () => {
// BasedOn present and in correct format if intent = order

pm.test("GIVEN I send a request with an existing and valid medication request ID, WHEN the response is returned, THEN the property BasedOn.reference exists AND it starts with 'MedicationRequest/'", () => {
// BasedOn not present if intent = plan
pm.test("GIVEN I send a request with an existing and valid medication request ID, WHEN the response is returned, THEN the property BasedOn.reference does not exit", () => {

## Overview

request.description:
## Overview

Use this end point to check the status of past and current prescription request.

If a Patient identifier is provided past and present requests will be returned for the patient inside as multiple Task rescources inside a Bundle resource.

If just the id of a specific request is passed a singular Task resource will be returned inside a Bundle resource.

If the prescription request is then sent to EPS to be fulfilled the EPS id of the new MedicationRequest must be included in the output element of the Task resource. 

You must provide at least one of the following parameters:

* id

* patient

request.description:
## Overview

Use this end point to create a request for a repeat prescription or repeat dispensing prescription.

The same end point can be used to request a prescription to a one off pharmacy nomination - the ODS code is set in Task.input using code [preferred-performer](https://simplifier.net/gpconnect2/gpconnect-prescriptionorderingparameters).

For this, send a Task with a focus of a prior MedicationRequest which has an intent of plan.

## Overview

Use this end point to check the status of past and current prescription request.

If a Patient identifier is provided past and present requests will be returned for the patient inside as multiple Task rescources inside a Bundle resource.

If just the id of a specific request is passed a singular Task resource will be returned inside a Bundle resource.

If the prescription request is then sent to EPS to be fulfilled the EPS id of the new MedicationRequest must be included in the output element of the Task resource. 

You must provide at least one of the following parameters:

* id

* patient
